arm_group.description: Conventional technique for Wichita nail extraction
Proposed technique for Wichita nail extraction

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to make clear how difficult it is to remove osteosynthesis
      materials afterwards, so surgeons will think twice before inserting intramedullary nails.
      Also it offers an alternative methode to remove the Wichita Fusion Nail after arthrodesis
      has become.

clinical_study.brief_title: Removal Wichita Fusion Nail After Knee Arthrodesis
clinical_study.condition: Removal Wichita Fusion Nail After Knee Arthrodesis.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Extraction of Wichita Fusion Nail

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  All other kinds of intramedullairy nails used to become a solid knee arhrodesis

study_pop.textblock: All patients who had to have their Wichita Fusion Nail extracted

intervention.intervention_name: Proposed technique for removal of the Wichita Fusion Nail

primary_outcome.description: Was the arthrodesis site left intact? How was the Nail removed? Time for operation?

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain measurement following the Visual Analogue Scale

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Retrospective
